intro: Lagochilus hispidus, commonly known as the hairy lips plant, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pink to purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stem, and bloom in late summer. Lagochilus hispidus is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
